de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.pipeline.splitters

Class ClientSplitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.pipeline.splitters.ClientSplitter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetworkDataSink

    public class ClientSplitter
extends java.lang.Object
implements NetworkDataSink
    This class can be used to split data from various devices to different pipelines. Sensor data will not be duplicated or copied, so sensor data can only be sent to a single data sink.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.HashMap<NetworkDevice,NetworkDataSink> mNetworkDataSinkMap
      This map is used to store which data sink gets data from which device

    • Method Detail

      • addDataSink

        public void addDataSink(NetworkDevice source,
                        NetworkDataSink dataSink)
        Add a new data sink which will receive all incoming data sent by the specified device
        Parameters:
        source - the device that must send the data
        dataSink - the sink that will receive data sent by the specified device

      • remove

        public void remove(NetworkDevice device)
        Remove the specified device. Data received from this device cannot be forwarded after calling this method
        Parameters:
        device - the device that will be ignored by this ClientSplitter from now on

      • remove

        public void remove(NetworkDataSink sink)
        Remove every instance of the specified data sink from this pipeline element
        Parameters:
        sink - the sink that should no longer receive data by this ClientSplitter

      • onData

        public void onData(NetworkDevice origin,
                   SensorData data,
                   float userSensitivity)
        Forward incoming data to the appropriate recipient
        Specified by:
        onData in interface NetworkDataSink
        Parameters:
        origin - network device that sent the data
        data - received data
        userSensitivity - sensitivity set by the user

      • close

        public void close()
        Unnecessary for this implementation
        Specified by:
        close in interface NetworkDataSink
